snippet: A report ruled on Cornelius Gurlitt’s collection, amassed by his father, a Nazi-era art dealer, said lawyers for a relative who contested the will.
abstract: Report ordered by German court finds collector Cornelius Gurlitt was of sound mind when he left 1,200 art works, including pieces stolen by Nazis, to Switzerland's Kunstmuseum Bern; Gurlitt’s cousin Uta Werner has been challenging bequest and lower court dismissed her claim to trove.
lead_paragraph: A report ruled on Cornelius Gurlitt’s collection, amassed by his father, a Nazi-era art dealer, said lawyers for a relative who contested the will.

headline.main: Report Declares Gurlitt of Sound Mind in Leaving Art to Museum
headline.print_headline: Court Report Issued on Gurlitt’s Will
